title: Harbaugh out as Ravens coach after playoff miss
content: The Ravens have fired John Harbaugh, less than 48 hours after losing to the Steelers and failing to reach the playoffs. Sources told ESPN that he's expected to emerge as a favorite for the Giants job but will be in demand for many other teams, as well.

title: Sources: Commanders' Kingsbury, Whitt both out
content: The Washington Commanders and OC Kliff Kingsbury have mutually agreed to go their separate ways, while DC Joe Whitt Jr. has been fired, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Falcons rework Cousins deal, set up key decision
content: The Falcons and Kirk Cousins agreed to modify the final two years of the QB's contract, setting the stage for a decision on his Atlanta future to be made by the third day of the 2026 NFL league year on March 13, a source told ESPN.

title: A's denied 'Athletics' trademark ahead of LV shift
content: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office has denied the A's request to trademark the names "Las Vegas Athletics" and "Vegas Athletics." The club currently plays in Sacramento, but intends to move to Nevada in 2028.

title: Ex-MSU star apologizes for verbally abusing ref
content: Former Michigan State star Paul Davis apologized for verbally abusing an offical to the point where he was kicked out of the Spartans' win over Southern California on Monday.

title: Pro athletes in Venezuela facing travel turmoil
content: Scores of athletes in Venezuela, particularly baseball players affiliated with MLB clubs, had travel schedules thrown into turmoil after the United States' military operation.

title: ⚽ Inside story: Why Man United fired Amorim
content: Ruben Amorim was seen as a risky choice to lead Man United's rebuild in November 2024, and ultimately, it didn't work out with news of Monday's firing. Here's how things broke down publicly and behind closed doors.

title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
content: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.

content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order.

content: Outside of that one blowout loss, the Zags are unbeaten -- and could stay that way until Selection Sunday.

content: The new year has brought some big upsets, a shake-up of the top 16 seeds and a new-look Bracketology.

content: The Packers need a WR1? The Broncos can't keep winning tight games? The Pats' run defense and the Seahawks' run offense are problems? We're not so sure.

content: In search of a new coach, Cleveland enters an offseason with first-round picks and unsettled questions at QB.

content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

content: Ahead of Saturday's playoff game, the Rams quarterback's demeanor and football IQ renders him a unique signal-caller.

content: Williams thought Johnson didn't like him at one point, but the duo evolved to lead the playoff-bound Bears.

title: Montana St. tops Illinois St. in wild FCS title game
content: Montana State won its first national championship since 1984 in Monday's first OT in FCS title game history.

title: Who will be Man United's next manager? 12 top candidates to replace Amorim
content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: Supercopa de España: Can Real Madrid, Atletico or Athletic stop Barça?
content: Here's all you need to know about the 2026 Supercopa de España, with Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atlético Madrid and Athletic Club vying for the crown this week.

content: García's star turn is the latest sign that Spain might have a genuine goalkeeping battle on their hands.

title: The best high school boys' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Link Academy (Miss.) takes the No. 1 spot to start the calendar year, with Spire Academy (Ohio) making the biggest jump to No. 2 in January.

title: The best high school girls' basketball teams in 2025-26
content: Ontario Christian (Calif.) stays atop the 2025-26 SC Next girls' high school rankings as the showcase of the month is the Hoophall Classic.

content: Pro wrestling insiders identify their top stars and biggest moments of 2025 in WWE, AEW and other top promotions.

content: Terence Crawford, Gabriela Fundora, Rolando "Rolly" Romero and others were part of the best boxing moments of 2025.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City still keen on Guéhi move
content: Manchester City are looking to reinforce at center back, with Crystal Palace's Marc Guéhi being of interest. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Schools up to Class 8 in Noida shut till January 10 due to cold wave
content: The order applies to all recognised schools affiliated with the CBSE, ICSE, IB, the Uttar Pradesh Board and other boards operating in the district

title: In an age of nationalism, a month-long art exhibition in Kolkata on the idea of land
content: Land carries deep cultural and emotional significance, anchoring identity, heritage and community ties, curator Ina Puri says

title: Economist Amartya Sen not required to attend SIR hearing over spelling error, says ECI
content: The Commission emphasised that minor errors in voters' names do not affect the hearing process or a voter's rights, and authorities have been warned to avoid creating public disputes over such technicalities

title: BJP planning to manipulate electoral rolls, ‘delete names of 10,000 voters’: Assam MLA
content: Akhil Gogoi says  MLAs and district presidents were given a January 12 deadline to submit booth-wise lists of voters who do not vote for the BJP, so that their names could be deleted

title: Doctors’ stir: Odisha govt. invokes ESMA
content: Over 6000 doctors in 32 district headquarter hospitals, 300 community health centres and other primary health centres are participating in the strike

title: Luxembourg 'very important' partner for India: Jaishankar
content: New Delhi and Luxembourg can collaborate much more on many interesting issues, including fintech, space, the digital world, and AI, the External Affairs Minister said

title: NMC withdraws Mata Vaishno Devi varsity’s MBBS list with 42 Muslim candidates citing 'non-compliance'; BJP welcomes move
content: Officials said the NMC’s Medical Assessment and Rating Board withdrew the Letter of Permission granted to the varsity in Reasi for running the MBBS course with 50 seats for 2025-26

title: Grok obscene AI content: govt. gives X time till January 7 to submit report
content: The government had issued a stern warning to the Elon Musk-led social media platform over indecent and sexually-explicit content being generated through misuse of AI-based services like 'Grok' and other tools

title: Kalamassery municipality seeks easing of curbs on construction works
content: Restrictions under green zone regulation will impact setting up of buildings on land proposed for judicial city, says municipal chairperson

title: Shoddy waste management should be blamed on lack of proper mechanism: experts
content: The panellists listed the gaps in strategy, policy, and implementation of schemes, while acknowledging some of the positive models that have made an impact, like the Indore project and the decentralised model in Noida

title: No offline quota of SriVani darshan tickets at Tirumala from January 9
content: 800 tickets, issued daily through offline counters, will be migrated to online platform; offline current booking of 200 tickets at Tirupati airport, however, to continue

title: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan’s remarks on ‘PM kidnap’ sparks a row
content: Referring to capture of Venezuela’s Maduro, the former Union Minister later said he was not predicting anything, but was issuing a warning that countries need to stand together to maintain global order

title: MLC Kavitha’s resignation accepted by Council chairman
content: Legislature Secretariat issues notification and notifies vacancy for Nizamabad Local Authorities Constituency.

title: ED uncovers ‘suspected misuse’ of foreign funds to influence India’s energy policy
content: On January 5, the agency searched various premises linked to SSPL in the national capital region as part of an ongoing investigation into suspicious foreign inward remittances

title: APSRTC prioritises intra-State services for Sankranti travel
content: 8,432 special buses planned as Stree Shakthi scheme drives higher passenger movement to district towns and villages

title: BJP-led Centre undermining Haryana, says Hooda
content: Hooda demanded that Haryana be designated as the host or co-host state for the 2030 Commonwealth Games and the proposed 2036 Olympics

title: Ready for further probe in Ankita Bhandari murder case: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
content: Dhami said the case has affected Uttarakhand residents who, he added, have “expressed their views with sensitivity”

title: Prevention key to tackling human trafficking, says official
content: Suryakumari stresses early intervention, coordinated implementation of schemes and community awareness at regional Training of Trainers programme in Vijayawada

title: State to act firmly against hate speech and misinformation on social media
content: Lokesh calls for stronger monitoring and age-based norms, while Anitha highlights delays in cybercrime cases and need for faster charge sheets

title: Rethinking India’s skilling outcomes | Explained
content: What prevents skilling from becoming a first-choice pathway for youth? Why has formal vocational training reached only a small share of the workforce? What limits industry participation in public skilling programmes? Why do Sector Skill Councils lack credibility with employers?

title: Madras High Court Chief Justice keeps mandatory e-filing requirement in abeyance
content: The move comes following difficulties expressed by lawyers practising in the district judiciary in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

title: BJP, Congress brace for showdown in Punjab over new rural jobs scheme
content: While the BJP will kick off a campaign exposing ‘misleading propaganda’ and highlighting the benefits of the new Act, the Congress will take to the streets to ‘save MGNREGA’

title: Indian farmers fear a flood of cheap New Zealand apples if duty cuts take effect
content: Traders fear the agreement could hit apples stored for the off-season trade hard; there are presently 397.08 lakh metric tonnes of apples in 92 cold storages across Kashmir

title: Rising attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh deeply worrying: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma says, the worsening situation in Bangladesh and evidence of growing jihadist activities in Assam over the last 10 years points to a security threat

title: Sonia Gandhi admitted to Delhi's Ganga Ram Hospital; condition stable
content: According to sources, Ms. Gandhi’s condition is stable; hospital sources say she is suffering from chronic cough, likely aggravated due to pollution in Delhi

title: VTU to act on private companies demanding money from students instead of providing paid-internships
content: Students have complained that some companies are luring them by promising to provide internship certificates without having to work if they pay

title: Frequent parole to Gurmeet Singh is ‘very disappointing’, says son of slain journalist; seeks court intervention
content: The Dera Sacha Sauda chief serving a 20-year jail term for raping two of his disciples, had walked out of Sunaria jail in Rohtak on Monday after he was granted a 40-day parole — the 15th time since his conviction in 2017

title: T.N. govt. notifies SOP for large public gatherings
content: The SOP will apply to all public meetings, processions, road shows, demonstrations, protests, cultural and religious events and any other form of public gathering in Tamil Nadu where the anticipated number of participants exceeds 5,000

title: For civic polls, Congress-led Mumbai Vikas Aghadi promises to stop privatisation of hospitals
content: In its manifesto, the Aghadi — comprising the Congress, Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi, Rashtriya Samaj Party, and Republican Party of India (Gavai) — promises AI-integrated, world-class education, and improved parking services

title: NC leaders oppose separate Statehood for Jammu, push for ‘reunification of Ladakh’
content: The government would ultimately have to move towards reunification, maintaining that the idea of a divided Jammu and Kashmir is unsustainable, NC Minister Javed Rana says

title: NTR laid strong foundation for Rayalaseema irrigation projects, says Minister Ramanaidu
content: Focused attention by the present coalition government has improved water management, with reservoirs and tanks across the region showing healthy storage levels, asserts the Water Resources Minister

title: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan releases 55 literary works developed by classical language centres
content: The move was a part of our larger national effort to place India’s linguistic heritage at the centre of education, research and cultural pride, the Minister said.

title: Study Qatar model for Sports City development in Amaravati, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The CRDA, at its 57th meeting, approves proposals to develop Krishna riverfront as Marina Waterfront and ₹5,000 monthly pension to orphaned minors in the capital region under the LPS, and ratifies 754 posts across various cadres in the CRDA

title: Piyush Goyal to visit Brussels in ‘decisive push’ to conclude India-EU FTA talks
content: Mr. Goyal’s visit comes just weeks before EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and EU Council President Antonio Costa are set to attend India’s Republic Day as chief guests ahead of the EU-India Summit.

title: Doctors across Telangana to hold black badge protest on January 7 against G.O. 229
content: The government order, issued on December 22, threatens the autonomy and democratic functioning of the Telangana Medical Council, according to doctors

title: Actor Mohanlal to be ‘goodwill ambassador’ of KSRTC
content: KSRTC’s ticket collection sets a new record, with the corporation netting a total of ₹12.18 crore as collection from ticket revenue

title: Naukuchiatal: A nine-cornered escape into the Kumaon Hills
content: After months of Delhi’s acrid haze, this lesser-known Uttarakhand lake town offers a quick getaway to clear waters, deep forests, and the soft, uncanny calm that once pulled Dale Cooper into ‘Twin Peaks’

title: State task force calls for anti-larval drive, study on dog bite deaths
content: Experts stress stronger disease surveillance, public awareness and time-bound action to curb communicable diseases in Andhra Pradesh

title: T.N. Cabinet clears TAPS; Stalin to launch ‘Ungal Kanavai Sollungal’ household survey
content: The State government plans to launch a month-long household survey aimed at gathering feedback from families on government schemes and identifying priority issues they expect the State government to address, says Minister for School Education Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi

title: Elections to standing committees in progress in Kozhikode Corporation
content: Mandatory female members were elected first to each standing committee on Tuesday, except the finance committee, which does not require an election. Polls were held to the development, health, works and welfare standing committees on the first day.

title: ED files supplementary chargesheet in Sahiti Infratec money laundering case
content: More than 700 home-buyers were defrauded of nearly ₹360 crore after being promised delivery of flats and villas

title: Create awareness on government schemes: Nellore MP to officials
content: Central government has recently sanctioned national highways worth Rs. 1 lakh crore to AP on the request on Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu, said Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy

title: ASI data key to State, national economic estimates: NSO offiical
content: Officials brief factory units on the revised online returns system and compliance requirements under the Collection of Statistics Act, 2008.

title: The 2026 money playbook: 10 moves that matter more than stock tips
content: Indian investors navigated a turbulent 2025, with gold outperforming equities and SIP inflows soaring. As macro signals shift towards growth, 2026 demands disciplined processes over prediction. The focus is on formalizing asset allocation, scaling contributions, and protecting against behavioral mistakes to anchor wealth.

title: Civic wars 2026: Thackerays reunite, alliances shift — Maharashtra's BMC power game explained
content: Maharashtra gears up for crucial local body elections on January 15, marking the first electoral test of 2026. These polls, delayed by legal battles, will see alliances like the Mahayuti and Maha Vikas Aghadi vying for control of key urban centers, including the financially significant Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation.

title: Office mandate fallout: AT&T exits longtime home after WFO push; read CEO John Stankey’s memo
content: Telecom giant AT&T is moving its global headquarters to Plano, Texas. The company will build a new corporate campus on a 54-acre site. This move consolidates three existing Dallas-area locations. The new headquarters will be designed for collaboration and innovation. Employee feedback drove the decision for modern workspaces. Partial occupancy is targeted for the second half of 2028.

title: ‘Nobody could’ve done that’: Trump pats self over Maduro capture; makes ‘torture centres’ claims
content: US President Trump addressed House Republicans, highlighting US military supremacy following an operation in Venezuela targeting Nicolás Maduro. He criticized Democrats for not acknowledging the operation's success and accused the "radical left" of backing paid protesters supporting the Venezuelan leader, alleging Maduro has killed and tortured millions.

title: 'Can't be labs of hate': JNU vows strict action over anti-PM slogans; FIR filed against students
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University will take the strictest action against students who raised slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and  Union home minister Amit Shah. The university stated it cannot be a laboratory of hate. Freedom of speech is a right, but universities are centers of learning. Violence and activities undermining national unity will not be tolerated.

title: Excluded from IPL, Bangladesh's Mustafizur joins Pakistan Super League
content: "Batters better shake carefully… its going to Fizz in the #NewEra. Mustafizur Rahman joins HBL PSL 11!" the league wrote.

title: Math genius Joel David Hamkins says AI models are basically useless for math tasks
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Ahead of poll, Sarma races to woo women with Rs 10,000 scheme
content: Assam is on a mission to empower women through self-employment, with the government allocating Rs 10,000 seed capital to over 1.5 million women via the MMUA initiative. This ambitious program aims to cultivate 4 million 'Lakhpati Baideos' in time for the upcoming elections, invigorating rural economies and fostering female entrepreneurship.

title: OpenAI IPO plans: Altman says no interest in public firms CEO role; timeline uncertain
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed zero enthusiasm for leading a public company, despite acknowledging an IPO is likely necessary for capital and growth.  While he finds public market participation in value creation appealing, he anticipates the process will be 'annoying.'  The AI giant, valued at potentially $1 trillion, is reportedly preparing for a 2026 or 2027 listing.

title: Rich can’t bypass tiers of court & come directly to us: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court, led by CJI Surya Kant, asserted that the rich and influential cannot bypass judicial tiers to approach the SC directly. The bench refused to hear a plea challenging a PMLA provision, stating that influential individuals must face trial like ordinary citizens. The court indicated that similar pending pleas challenging the PMLA's validity would be heard together.

title: Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones’ love story: Inside their family journey
content: Wayne Gretzky, the greatest player in the history of the NHL, has had a rich personal life with his wife, Janet Jones Gretzky, besides his legendary career in hockey. Since the time they met in 1984 and made love and even had five children, their lives have been marked with love, family events, and even moments in front of the crowd that can be used to demonstrate how the couple has remained together despite their fame over the years.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly shaken by Travis Kelce’s controversial confession
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dealing with a lot on their plate ever since they announced their engagement last year. While the two have kept themselves busy with planning their wedding, it seems Taylor Swift is deeply unsettled by some of Travis Kelce's words that he has said in public about his past. It seems this has become a huge deal for Taylor Swift ahead of their wedding.

title: Andrew McCutchen and Maria Hanslovan’s combined net worth and MLB earnings
content: Andrew McCutchen's stellar MLB career, marked by five All-Star selections and an MVP award, has been the bedrock of his substantial finances, amassing over $131 million from contracts. His wife, Maria Hanslovan, contributes significantly through her thriving fitness and wellness career. Together, their combined net worth is estimated between $60-$65 million, bolstered by endorsements and joint assets.

title: Detained for ‘sharing sensitive info with Pak’: 14-yr-old spy mapped Army posts for ISI
content: Pakistani intelligence has reportedly recruited a 14-year-old boy from Jammu and Kashmir to map military installations, exploiting his psychological struggles and tech-savviness. Manipulated through social media, he was allegedly promised weapons and support by ISI operatives. Authorities are now expanding their investigation and urging parents to monitor children's online activities.

title: West Bengal school that received Chavez largesse prays for peace in Venezuela
content: A primary school on Kolkata's outskirts, which received a Rs 12 lakh grant from Venezuela during Hugo Chavez's presidency, held a special prayer for peace in the South American nation. The funds, received in 2007, were used to construct new rooms and improve safety at the Bagu Junior Basic School.

title: BJP allies with Cong to snatch Maha civic body from Sena
content: In a surprising political development, the BJP and Congress have formed an alliance in Ambernath, joining forces with the Ajit Pawar-led NCP to control the municipal council. This coalition, named Ambernath Vikas Aghadi, excludes the Shiv Sena, which emerged as the single-largest party but failed to secure the municipal president's post.

title: PIOs in UK see wealth soar, whilst Pakistanis see ‘notable decline’: LSE report
content: A new LSE report reveals significant wealth increases for white British and Indian ethnic groups in the UK since 2012. Conversely, individuals of Pakistani ethnicity experienced a sharp decline in median wealth, while black African, black Caribbean, and Bangladeshi groups reported minimal accumulated household wealth.

title: Centre imposes norms for AI-based cancer detection
content: The Indian government has brought AI-based cancer detection software under formal regulatory oversight, classifying them as Class C medical devices. This move ensures official approval, safety validation, and ongoing monitoring for AI tools used in analyzing medical images for cancer diagnosis. The regulation aims to protect patients and ensure scientifically validated claims by developers as AI's role in healthcare expands.

title: At 30%, Lucknow reports highest per cent of deletions
content: Over 1 crore voters are in the 'unmapped' category and will receive notices to submit documents for verification. Lucknow reported the highest deletion rate at 30%, with a significant portion attributed to permanently shifted voters, nearly double that of Bihar. The enumeration deadline was extended twice due to large numbers of excluded voters.

title: Venezuela crisis: US operation killed 55 Venezuelan, Cuban troops
content: US forces killed 55 Venezuelan and Cuban military personnel during their stunning raid to capture Nicolas Maduro, tolls published by Caracas and Havana showed Tuesday. Cuba, which had already announced that 32 members of its armed forces and interior ministry security personnel assigned to duties in Caracas were killed in the raids, also listed its dead.

title: Who is Robin Givens? Mike Tyson’s ex-wife, fame, divorce, and controversy
content: Robin Givens, a prominent 1990s celebrity and actress, married boxing legend Mike Tyson in 1988. Their highly publicized union, considered a high-profile celebrity marriage, lasted only one year. Following their divorce, which involved allegations of abuse and legal battles, both careers faced negative impacts. Givens later became a public advocate for women's empowerment and continued her acting career.

title: With gun in hand, Lalu's daughter Rohini Acharya warns 'enemies'
content: Lalu Prasad's daughter Rohini Acharya posted a picture with a gun, stating she can discern right from wrong with a perfect aim. This follows a public spat with her brother Tejashwi Yadav after the Bihar assembly election results, where she alleged mistreatment and quit politics.

title: Baby formula recall across multiple countries: Safety concerns and symptoms to watch
content: Nestlé is taking responsible action by recalling particular batches of its infant formula over a concern regarding the ingredient arachidonic acid oil. Although there have been no reported illnesses linked to this recall, it stems from the rare presence of a toxin named cereulide.

title: Travis Kelce faces online backlash as fans question finances of his foundation
content: Travis Kelce's nonprofit, the Eighty-Seven and Running Foundation, faces scrutiny over its spending, with reports indicating only 41 cents of every dollar went to charitable programs from 2021-24.  Concerns were also raised about the initial board composition and payments to a management group. The foundation claims misclassification in earlier filings and is implementing changes to address these issues.

title: Cavaliers vs Pacers injury report: Who’s out and where to watch
content: The Cleveland Cavaliers visit the Indiana Pacers on January 6, 2026, with both teams significantly impacted by player absences. Cleveland, aiming to solidify its playoff position, faces an Indiana squad struggling with a lengthy injury list. Key players out for both sides will test depth and force new offensive focal points.

title: Smith's Dean Jones moment; asks Carse to 'turn' his sunglasses - watch
content: A bizarre incident during the Ashes saw Steve Smith request bowler Brydon Carse to adjust his sunglasses due to sunlight glare. Carse promptly complied, moving them to the back of his head. Meanwhile, Smith achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second-highest run-scorer in Ashes history, surpassing Jack Hobbs.

title: SIR row: EC tells SC it has power to undertake electoral roll revision
content: The Election Commission informed the Supreme Court of its power and constitutional competence to conduct a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls to exclude foreigners. Appearing for the EC, senior advocate Rakesh Dwivedi argued that citizenship is a foundational requirement for holding public office and that the Constitution mandates the removal of non-citizens from voter lists.

title: Chris Paul vs Damian Lillard net worth: NBA salaries, endorsements and more
content: NBA stars Chris Paul and Damian Lillard boast impressive net worths, fueled by lucrative contracts and endorsements. Paul's estimated $180 million net worth and over $400 million in career earnings highlight his sustained success. Lillard, with a $100 million net worth and over $365 million in career earnings, also commands significant income despite a recent injury absence.

title: India–US trade row: Trump claims PM Modi ‘not that happy’ with him over steep tariffs
content: US President Trump stated Prime Minister Modi is "not that happy" due to US tariffs on Indian purchases of Russian oil. He linked trade pressure to India's energy ties with Moscow, noting India has significantly reduced its Russian oil imports. Trump also mentioned India's concerns over delayed US military hardware deliveries.

title: 'Will Trump kidnap PM?' Chavan's bizarre remark amid Venezuela crisis; BJP hits back
content: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan linked US trade tensions and tariffs on India to the alleged CIA-led operation in Venezuela, questioning if President Trump would kidnap India's Prime Minister. He criticised the government's silence on Venezuela and its perceived fear of the US, highlighting India's need to find alternative export markets due to the 50% US tariff.

title: 'One step ahead': Yuvraj explains why Gill is more consistent than Abhishek Sharma
content: Yuvraj Singh reveals the distinct paths of Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma, nurtured under his guidance. Gill's exceptional dedication and adaptability propelled his rapid ascent, while Sharma's rise followed a structured four-year plan focused on national selection. Yuvraj highlights their contrasting styles: Sharma's fearless T20 aggression versus Gill's patient, consistent approach, creating a potent duo for Indian cricket.

title: ‘Dad I tell you …’: Nicolas Maduro's son sends defiant message, gets emotional - watch
content: Venezuelan lawmaker Nicolas Maduro Guerra delivered an emotional plea in the national assembly following his father President Maduro's capture by US forces. He pledged loyalty to interim President Delcy Rodríguez and expressed hope for his father's swift return.  Maduro, facing drug trafficking charges in New York, declared himself 'still the leader of Venezuela,' intensifying regional tensions.

title: Dwyane Wade net worth: NBA earnings, endorsements, investments and more
content: Dwyane Wade has built a significant financial empire beyond his NBA career, with an estimated net worth of $170 million. His success stems from a lucrative lifetime deal with Li-Ning, sports ownership in the Utah Jazz and Chicago Sky, and diverse ventures like the baby care brand Proudly and investments in the culinary space.

title: Kapil Dev turns 67: The all-rounder Indian cricket never replaced
content: Kapil was not the fastest, nor did he possess the most unplayable delivery among his contemporaries. Playing at the same time as Imran Khan, Ian Botham and Hadlee, comparisons were inevitable. His strike rate — fewer than four wickets per Test — did not scream dominance. What did stand out was accuracy, stamina and movement, particularly his ability to swing the ball away from right-handers.

title: Fatty liver symptoms that are mistaken for an upset stomach
content: Ignored by many as just a touch of indigestion, persistent bloating, fullness after a light meal, and mild nausea could hint at something more serious: fatty liver disease. The accompanying discomfort in the upper right abdomen and feelings of unexplained fatigue are often brushed aside, but recognising these signs early can prevent significant health issues.

title: Noida marriage row: Woman alleges husband hid baldness despite ‘thick hair’ promise
content: A Noida woman has filed a police case against her husband and in-laws, alleging deception regarding his appearance, education, and income. The bride claims her husband, Sanyam Jain, misled her about being bald and also threatened her with private photos and physical assault. She further accused him of pressuring her to smuggle marijuana from Thailand.

title: Scientists say bad memories could be rewritten while you sleep
content: A recent study reveals that positive memories, especially during sleep, can weaken the impact of negative ones. Researchers found that by re-associating neutral cues with pleasant images, participants later recalled negative associations less vividly. This gentle crowding out, particularly during sleep's memory processing phase, offers a promising, non-invasive avenue for managing distressing recollections.

title: Russia oil trade: India imported €144bn worth of crude since start of Ukraine war
content: India has emerged as Russia's second-largest crude oil buyer, importing approximately 144 billion euros since the Ukraine war began. This surge followed Western nations' reduced imports, significantly boosting Russia's fossil fuel earnings. While India's purchases have recently dipped due to fresh sanctions, the trend highlights a major shift in global energy trade dynamics.

title: Sakat Chauth moonrise timing 2026: When the moon will be visible tonight across India
content: Sakat Chauth, observed today, involves a day-long fast broken only after moonrise. Families gather on balconies, patiently awaiting the celestial signal for prayers and the end of their observance. This tradition emphasizes faith and togetherness, with devotion being paramount even if the moon is obscured.

title: Shooter Who Killed Brown Students, MIT Professor Planned Attack For Months
content: The self-described "animal" behind a mass shooting at Brown University and the killing of an MIT professor admitted to the crimes in a video made after the spree but gave no motive, authorities said Tuesday.

title: UP SIR: Lucknow Records Highest Voter Deletions, Ghaziabad Second
content: Following the completion of the enumeration phase of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Uttar Pradesh, the Office of the state Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) has said that Lucknow has the highest number of voters deleted in the draft Electoral roll.

title: Trump Says His Voters Loved Venezuela Attack. Here's A Fact Check
content: It's only been days since an audacious US raid snatched Nicols Maduro from a Venezuelan military base and sped him to a Brooklyn prison, yet Detroit-area Trump supporter Aaron Tobin can already see it all playing out on the big screen.

title: US Says "Military Always An Option" To Acquire Greenland From Denmark
content: President Donald Trump is looking at a number of ideas for acquiring Greenland from Denmark and using the US military is "always an option," the White House said on Tuesday.

title: Air India Issue Advisory Amid Fog-Related Disruptions In Delhi, North India
content: Air India on Tuesday issued a travel advisory for passengers flying on the morning of January 7, warning that heavy fog and reduced visibility over Delhi and parts of northern India could disrupt flight operations across its network.

title: Trump Officials In Talks With Venezuela On Oil Exports To US: Report
content: US refineries on the Gulf Coast can process Venezuela's crude and have imported it in the past, before the US imposed sanctions on Venezuela.

title: National Medical Commission Revokes Recognition Of Jammu College Amid Row
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has revoked the recognition of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence (SMVDIME) in Jammu.

title: Venezuela Under Maduro Shipped Gold Worth $5.2 Billion To Switzerland
content: Venezuela transported gold worth almost 4.14 billion Swiss francs ($5.20 billion) to Switzerland during the early years of the leadership of ousted President Nicolas Maduro, customs data shows.

title: Venezuela Crisis May Lead To Cheaper Crude Oil: Niti Aayog Member To NDTV
content: Dr Arvind Virmani, renowned economist and a member of the NITI Aayog, said he believes if the oil fields of Venezuela are revived within six months, more oil will reach the market, and crude oil prices will drop.

title: 3 Indians Arrested With Ganja Worth Over Rs 14.5 Crore At Colombo Airport
content: Three Indian nationals were arrested in Sri Lanka for allegedly possessing 50 kg of cannabis, valued at LKR 500 million (over Rs 14.5 crore), in the largest narcotics haul at Colombo international airport, officials said on Tuesday.

title: 15 Endangered Indian Vultures Released In Maharashtra Tiger Reserve
content: The Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS) has released 15 critically endangered Indian vultures at the Melghat Tiger Reserve in Maharashtra as part of its ongoing vulture conservation programme, officials said.

title: Delhi Records First Cold Day Of 2026, More Snow Predicted In Hill States
content: The winter tightened its hold across North India on Tuesday with snowfall in hilly states and lowering temperatures across northern India, including the national capital which recorded its first cold day of the year.

title: Student Forced To Perform Namaz At Maharashtra College, Probe Launched
content: An unidentified girl allegedly forced a fellow female student to perform 'namaz' at a private medical college's hostel in Wada taluka of Maharashtra's Palghar, prompting the management of the institute to suspend a hostel warden and a teacher.

title: "Big In 2025, Less Of A Story In 2026": Ian Bremmer To NDTV On US Tariffs
content: The tariff hike by the US might have been the big headline grabbing controversies of 2025, but it will be tapering off this year, Ian Bremmer, the chief of the Eurasia Group has said.

title: US To Lead Ukraine Ceasefire Monitoring, Back Europe Led Force: Report
content: The United States would lead a "ceasefire monitoring and verification mechanism" with European participation if a peace deal is agreed in the Russia-Ukraine war, Kyiv's allies said, according to a report.

title: "It's Not Regime Change, It's Regime Roulette": Ian Bremmer On US' Venezuela Op
content: Ian Bremmer, President of Eurasia Group, said that Venezuela's regime change backed by the United States is a "regime roulette". In an exclusive interview with NDTV, Bremmer described the new administration in Venezuela as similar to the old one.

title: 'Make Iran Great Again': Trump Signs Hat As US Vows To Save Iran Protesters
content: Iran has been gripped by widespread unrest after protests erupted in Tehran on December 28 and quickly spread to several other cities.

title: Fire Breaks Out In Residential Building In Mumbai's Bandra, None Hurt
content: A fire broke out in a 12-storey residential building in Mumbai's Bandra (East) area on Tuesday night though no one was injured in the blaze, officials said.

title: 2-Year-Old Attacked By 8 Stray Dogs In Karnataka, Hospitalised
content: A two-year-old boy was grievously injured after being allegedly attacked by stray dogs here, hospital authorities said on Tuesday.

title: Family Of Woman Killed In US Seeks International Arrest Warrant Against Suspect
content: The family members of Nikitha Godishala, who was found dead in US, want the authorities there to issue an international arrest warrant against the suspect in her alleged killing for his quick arrest.

content: Tamaghna Banerjee, a reporter from Kolkata, covers crime, aviation, human rights and politics. He has a keen interest in human interest and rural reporting. He has done his postgraduation in journalism and mass communication. He has a total of 14 years in journalism. Read More

title: Venezuela’s interim Prez visited Sai Baba ashram multiple times
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: Europe sees red over Greenland as Trump aide asserts it belongs to US

title: 'A failed state': How Somalia slid from independence into permanent crisis
content: events that have unfolded in the Horn of Africa for more than seven decades have rarely garnered sustained global attention . what exists today is absence or collapse, but accumulation: layers of unresolved conflict built atop climate shocks, poverty, displacement and chronically fragile governance . when rains fail, hunger spreads, violence and displacement follow .

content: Penn State coach Terry Smith is showered with grass clippings after the win over Clemson . the teams most disappointed with how 2025 played out, loosely ranked in eight categories . four preseason top-ranked teams are most disappointed . a team that has won a title in the past 24 years has lost a season .

title: Nathan MacKinnon vs. Macklin Celebrini for MVP?

title: What does Pete Carroll's exit mean for the Raiders, Geno Smith?
content: Pete Carroll led the Raiders to a 3-14 record -- his worst as a coach . the 74-year-old was fired on monday with 17 games into his three-year deal . he was "blindly optimistic" about the talent on the roster .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: 2026 Unrivaled megapreview: Rosters, rankings, rules, how to watch
content: 54 of the league's top players are in Miami as the second season of unrivaled tips off . the 3-on-3 league was created to give players a domestic offseason playing opportunity . each member of this season's championship team will win an additional $100,000 .

title: Tracking live who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Morton fired as Lions' OC after just one season
content: the Lions have fired offensive coordinator John Morton after one season, the team announced . Morton was brought in to replace Ben Johnson, who was hired as head coach of the Chicago Bears . head coach Dan Campbell took over the offensive playcalling duties from Morton in week 10 .
